text:
[Hanuman takes leave of Sita -- sets out for the northern shore -- Description of Arishta mountain]

ततस्तु शिंशुपामूले जानकीं पर्युपस्थिताम्।

अभिवाद्याब्रवीद्दिष्ट्या पश्यामि त्वामिहाक्षताम्।।5.56.1।।
meaning: ततः then, शिंशुपामूले under the simsupa tree, पर्युपस्थिताम् stationed, जानकीम् Janakai, अभिवाद्य offered salutation, अब्रवीत् said, दिष्ट्या luckily, अक्षताम् unscathed, त्वाम् you, इह here, पश्यामि I see you.
translation: Then Hanuman offered salutations to Janaki, stationed at the foot of the simsupa tree, and said, "Luckily I see you unscathed."

text:
ततस्तं प्रस्थितं सीता वीक्षमाणा पुनः पुनः।

भर्तृस्नेहान्वितं वाक्यं हनुमन्तमभाषत।।5.56.2।।
meaning: ततः then, प्रस्थितम् him who was ready to start his journey, तं हनुमन्तम् that Hanuman, पुनः पुनः again and again, वीक्षमाणा looking at him, सीता Sita, भर्तृस्नेहान्वितम् showing her love for her husband, वाक्यम् this word, अभाषत spoke.
translation: Looking at Hanuman again and again, as he was ready to start on his return journey, thus spoke Sita expressing her love for her husband:

text:
काममस्य त्वमेवैकः कार्यस्य परिसाधने।

पर्याप्तः परवीरघ्न यशस्यस्ते बलोदयः।।5.56.3।।
meaning: परवीरघ्नः destroyer of foes, अस्य कार्यस्य of this task, परिसाधने in this task (of rescuing), त्वम् you, एकः एव singlehanded, कामम् indeed, पर्याप्तः capable, ते to you, बलोदयः rise of strength, यशस्यः will bring glory.
translation: "O destroyer of foes, you are capable of rescuing me singlehanded. Your success will raise your strength and bring glory.

text:
शरैस्तु सङ्कुलां कृत्वा लङ्कां परबलार्दनः।

मां नयेद्यदि काकुत्स्थस्तत्तस्य सदृशं भवेत्।।5.56.4।।
meaning: परबलार्दनः slayer of enemy forces,काकुत्स्थः Kakutstha,लङ्काम् to Lanka, शरैः तु with arrows indeed, सङ्कुलाम् spreading, कृत्वा all over, माम् me, नयेद्यदि if he takes me, तत् that, तस्य for him, सदृशम् worthy, भवेत् will be.
translation: "If Kakutstha Rama, the slayer of enemy forces comes to Lanka, fills it with his arrows and takes me back, it will be worthy of him.

text:
तद्यथा तस्य विक्रान्तमनुरूपं महात्मनः।

भवत्याहवशूरस्य तथा त्वमुपपादय।।5.56.5।।
meaning: तत् that, महात्मनः the exalted, आहवशूरस्य who is chivalrous in the battle, तस्य his, विक्रान्तम् heroic advance, अनुरूपम् worthy of his stature, यथा as such, भवति will be, तथा that manner, त्वम् you, उपपादय act.
translation: "You should act in such a manner that the exalted Rama, who is chivalrous in the battlefield, exhibits his valour worthy of his stature".

text:
तदर्थोपहितं वाक्यं प्रश्रितं हेतुसंहितम्।

निशम्य हनुमांस्तस्या वाक्यमुत्तरमब्रवीत्।।5.56.6।।
meaning: हनुमान् Hanuman, प्रश्रितम् properly inclined, हेतुसंहितम् support with reason, अर्थोपहितम् meaningful, तस्याः her, तत् that, वाक्यम् word, निशम्य after hearing, उत्तरम् reply, वाक्यम् these words, अब्रवीत् spoke.
translation:
Hearing her meaningful reply which was welldisposed and reasonable, Hanuman
replied:

text:
क्षिप्रमेष्यति काकुत्स्थः हर्यृक्षप्रवरैर्वृतः।

यस्ते युधि विजित्यारीन् शोकं व्यपनयिष्यति।।5.56.7।।
meaning: काकुत्स्थः Kakutstha, हर्यृक्षप्रवरैः with the foremost among vanaras and bears, वृतः surrounded, क्षिप्रम् very soon, एष्यति he will come, यः he who, युधि in battle, अरीन् enemies, विजित्य having won, ते your, शोकम् sorrow, व्यपनयिष्यति will remove.
translation: "Rama will come soon with the best of vanaras and bears. He would win the battle and remove your sorrrow.

text:
एवमाश्वास्य वैदेहीं हनुमान् मारुतात्मजः।

गमनाय मतिं कृत्वा वैदेहीमभ्यवादयत्।।5.56.8।।
meaning: मारुतात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, एवम् in that way, आश्वास्य having consoled, गमनाय to depart, मतिम् his mind, कृत्वा after deciding, वैदेहीम् to Vaidehi, अभ्यवादयत् respectfully saluted.
translation: Hanuman, son of the Windgod having consoled Vaidehi, saluted her respectfully and decided to depart.

meaning: ततः then, अरिमर्दनः crusher of foes, सः he, कपिशार्दूलः a tiger among vanaras, स्वामिसन्दर्शनोत्सुकः anxious to see his lord, अरिष्टम् Arishta, गिरिश्रेष्ठम् excellent mountain, आरुरोह ascended.
translation: Then Hanuman, the crusher of enemies, a tiger among vanaras anxious to see his lord ascended the mount Arishta.

meaning: तुङ्गपद्मकजुष्टाभि: by those choicest tall padmaka trees, नीलाभिः by dark ones, वनराजिभिः with forest ranges, शृङ्गान्तरविलम्बिभिः hanging down from the spaces between the peaks of mountain, अम्भोदैः the rainy clouds, सोत्तरीयमिव as if covered with an upper garment.
translation: Mount Arishta was full of blue forestranges with choicest tall padmaka trees. With clouds hanging on the slopes of mountain peaks, it appeared as though the mountain was wrapped in an upper garment.

meaning: शुभैः with auspicious ones, दिवाकरकरैः with Sun's rays, प्रीत्या affectionately, बोध्यमानमिव as if he was being awakened, उद्धूतैः with those pushed up (by wind), लोचनैरिव like with the eyes, धातुभिः with the minerals, उन्मिषन्तमिव as if he opening.
translation: As if the mountain was awakened from sleep by the rays of the blessed Sun. With the colour of glowing minerals exuding, it was as if the mountain was looking out with his eyes open. (The minerals underneath the mud appear when wind blows removing the dust covering them. The glowing minerals are fancied to be eyes of the mountain.)

meaning: मन्द्रैः with loud, तोयौघनिस्वनैः sounds of gurgling masses of waters, प्राधीतमिव as if reciting (loudly), विस्पष्टैः with clear sounds, नानाप्रस्रवणस्वनैः with different kinds of sounds of waterfalls, प्रगीतमिव as if singing, पर्वतम् mountain.
translation:
With the loud sounds of masses of gurgling waters, the mountain appeared as though
it was standing and reciting (the Vedas) loudly. With murmuring sounds of different waterfalls, it appeared as though the mountain was singing. (The sage differentiates the steadily trickling watersound from the rhythmic musical sounds of waterfalls.)

meaning: अत्युच्चैः by the tall ones, देवदारुभिः with devadaru trees, ऊर्ध्वबाहुमिव as if with raised hands, स्थितम् standing, प्रपातजलनिर्घोषैः with the sounds of waterfalls, सर्वतः all over, प्राक्रुष्टमिव like the reverberations
translation: With the tall devadaru trees on the mountain, it appeared as if the sages were standing with shoulders lifted up and performing penance. The sounds of waterfalls filled all over with reverberations.

meaning: श्यामैः with dark ones, कम्पमानैः with shaking, शरद्वनैः clouds of autumn, वेपमानमिव as if trembling, वेणुभिः कीचकैः with hollow bamboos, मारुतोद्धूतैः hit by the wind, कीचकैः hollow bamboos rattling in the wind, कूजन्तमिव appearing like the warbling sound.
translation: The mountain appeared as if trembling with the dark clouds of autumn. The shrill sounds pasing through the hollow bamboos filled with air appeared as if it was producing sweet musical notes.

meaning: घोरैः with dreadful ones, आशीविषोत्तमैः with poisonous snakes, निःश्वसन्तमिव as if hissing, नीहारकृतगम्भीरैः with majestically covered heavy mist, गह्वरैः with caves, ध्यायन्तमिव as though meditating, controlling all senses.
translation: The mountain was as though hissing like a dreadful, poisonous snake. With the caves standing majestically covered with mist, the mountain appeared as if it was meditating.

meaning: मेघपादनिभैः appearing like the feet of clouds, पादैः with its feet, सर्वत: all over, प्रक्रान्तमिव as if traversing, अभ्रमालिभिः with ranges of clouds, शिखरैः with its peaks, आकाशे in the sky, जृम्भमाणमिव as if yawning.
translation: With the ranges of foothills appearing like the feet of clouds traversing, with its peaks like garlands of clouds traversing over the mountain, it made one feel it was yawning.

text:
कूटैश्च बहुधा कीर्णैश्शोभितं बहुकन्दरैः।

सालतालाश्वकर्णैश्च वंशैश्च बहुभिर्वृतम्।।5.56.17।।
meaning: बहुधा many kinds, कीर्णैः scattered with, बहुकन्दरैः with many caves, कूटैश्च with mountain peaks, शोभितम् delighting, बहुभिः with many, सालतालाश्वकर्णैश्च with Sal, palms, Aswakarna trees and, वंशैश्च with bamboos and reeds, वृतम् canopied with.
translation: With many kinds of caves and peaks scattered all over, the mountain looked delightful. It was canopied with numerous trees like Sal, palms, Aswakarnas and bamboos.

meaning: विततैः with those spread out, पुष्पवद्भिः with those filled with flowers, लतावितानैः with creepers stretched all over, अलङ्कृतम् decorated, नानामृगगणाकीर्णम् crowded with herds of animals, धातुनिष्यन्दभूषितम् decorated with colourful minerals dropping down.
translation: It was spread with creepers filled with beautiful flowers and herds of animals. The colourful minerals flowing down decorated the mountain.

meaning: बहुप्रस्रवणोपेतम् full of waterfalls, शिलासञ्चयसङ्कटम् with heaps of rocks making (the streams' flow difficult), महर्षियक्षगन्धर्वकिन्नरोरगसेवितम् attended with sages, yakshas, gandharvas, kinnaras and nagas.
translation: There were many streams of water flowing and rocks making it difficult for the streams to flow. The mountain was inhabited by sages, yakshas, gandharvas, kinnaras and nagas, and uragas.

meaning: लतापादपसङ्घातम् with clusters of creepers and trees, सिंहाध्युषितकन्दरम् caves inhabited by lions, व्याघ्रसङ्घसमाकीर्णम् herds of tigers scattered all over, स्वादुमूलफलद्रुमम् full of trees bearing tasty roots and fruits.
translation: The clusters of creepers, and trees bearing tasty fruits and roots were uprooted. There were caves inhabited by lions. Herds of tigers were scattered all over (by the impetus of Hanuman's pressure on the mountain).

meaning: पवनात्मजः son of the Windgod, हनुमान् Hanuman, रामदर्शनशीघ्रेण anxious to see Rama soon, प्रहर्षेण with joy, अभिचोदितः prompted, तं पर्वतम् that mountain, आरुरोह ascended.
translation: Anxious to see Rama soon, the son of the Windgod ascended the mountain happily.

meaning: ततः then, रम्येषु in delightful ones, गिरिसानुषु on mountain ranges, तेन by him, पादतलाक्रान्ताः crushed by his feet, शिलाः rocks, सघोषाः making loud sound, चूर्णीकृताः reduced to powder, समशीर्यन्त rolled down.
translation: Crushed under Hanuman's feet the rocks making a loud noise on the beautiful mountain ranges rolled down, reduced to powder.

text:
स तमारुह्य शैलेन्द्रं व्यवर्धत महाकपिः।

दक्षिणादुत्तरं पारं प्रार्थयन् लवणाम्भसः।।5.56.23।।
meaning: सः महाकपिः that great Hanuman, लवणाम्भसः of the saltwater ocean, दक्षिणात् from the South, उत्तरं पारम् towards northern shore, प्रार्थयन् desiring, तं शैलेन्द्रम् that king of mountains, आरुह्य having ascended, व्यवर्धत started enlarging body.
translation: On ascending the king of mountains, desiring to reach the northern shore of the saltwater ocean from the Southern shore, he enlarged his body (in preparation to leap).

text:
अधिरुह्य ततो वीरः पर्वतं पवनात्मजः।

ददर्श सागरं भीमं मीनोरगनिषेवितम्।।5.56.24।।
meaning: ततः then, वीरः hero, पवनात्मजः son of the Windgod, पर्वतम् mountain, अधिरुह्य having ascended, मीनोरगनिषेवितम् inhabited by fishes and sankes, भीमम् dreadful, सागरम् ocean, ददर्श saw.
translation: Then the heroic son of the Windgod, who had ascended the mountain saw the dreadful ocean inhabited by fishes and snakes.

text:
स मारुत इवाऽकाशं मारुतस्यात्मसम्भवः।

प्रपेदे हरिशार्दूलो दक्षिणादुत्तरां दिशम्।।5.56.25।।
meaning: मारुतस्य Windgod's, आत्मसम्भवः son, सः हरिशार्दूलः that tiger among monkeys, दक्षिणात् from the south, उत्तरांदिशम् towards northern side, मारुतः इव like the windgod, आकाशम् sky, प्रपेदे leaped.
translation: Hanuman, the tiger among monkeys leaped into the sky like the Windgod from the south to the north shore.

text:
स तदा पीडितस्तेन कपिना पर्वतोत्तमः।

ररास सह तैर्भूतैः प्रविशन्वसुधातलम्।।5.56.26।।

कम्पमानैश्च शिखरैः पतद्भिरपि च द्रुमैः।
meaning: तदा then, तेन कपिना by that vanara, पीडितः pressed, सः पर्वतोत्तमः that great mountain, तैः those, भूतैः सह along with the creatures, वसुधातलम् to the earth, प्रविशन् while entering, कम्पमानैः with shaking, शिखरैः with peaks, पतद्भिः with dropped, द्रुमैः with trees, ररास crushed down making great sound.
translation: Pressed under the feet of Hanuman, the great mountain made loud sound sinking into the earth along with all its creatures, with its shaken mountain peaks and uprooted trees dropping down.

meaning: तस्य his, ऊरुवेगात् with the force of his thighs, मथिताः shaken, पुष्पशालिनः trees with blossoms, पादपाः trees, रुग्णाः men suffering with diseases, शक्रायुधहता इव as if struck by Indra's thunderbolt, भूतले on the ground, निपेतुः fell.
translation:
Shaken by the violent force of Hanuman's thighs, the blossoming trees fell on the
ground like sickmen hit by Indra's thunderbolt.

text:
कन्दरान्तरसंस्थानां पीडितानां महौजसाम्।।5.56.28।।

सिंहानां निनदो भीमो नभो भिन्दन् स शुश्रुवे।
meaning: कन्दरान्तरसंस्थानाम् of those residing in mountain caves, पीडितानाम् of those crushed, महौजसाम् of the powerful ones, सिंहानाम् of lions, भीमः terrific, सः निनदः that noise, नभः sky, भिन्दन् as if breaking, शुश्रुवे was heard.
translation: The dreadful roar of strong lions, lying in mountaincaves was heard cracking the sky when they were crushed in the turmoil.

meaning: विद्याधर्यः Vidyadharis, त्रस्तव्यावृत्तवसनाः with their clothes slipped with fear, व्याकुलीकृतभूषणाः with ornaments disarrayed, सहसा at ones, धरणीधरात् from the mountain, समुत्पेतुः flew.
translation: The Vidyadharis with their clothes slipped and ornaments disarrayed in fear, at once flew from the mountain.

meaning: अतिप्रमाणाः very big ones in size, बलिनः strong ones, दीप्तजिह्वाः with glowing tongues, महाविषाः highly poisonous, महाहयः huge snakes, निपीडितशिरोग्रीवाः pressed on their heads and necks, व्यचेष्टन्त started protruding.
translation: Highly powerful, huge and poisonous snakes with their glowing tongues protruded, pressed on their heads and necks (by Hanuman).

meaning: तदा then, किन्नरोरगगन्धर्वयक्षविद्याधराः kinnaras, uragas, gandharvas, yakshas and vidyadharas, पीडितम् tormented, तं नगवरम् that mountain, त्यक्त्वा having left, गगनम् to the sky, आस्थिताः occupied.
translation: Then the kinnaras, uragas, gandhravas, yakshas and vidyadharas left the tortured mountain and occupied the sky.

text:
स च भूमिधरः श्रीमान्बलिना तेन पीडितः।।5.56.32।।

सवृक्षशिखरोदग्रः प्रविवेश रसातलम्।
meaning: बलिना by the powerful one, तेन by him, पीडितः crushed, सवृक्षशिखरोदग्रः along with its trees and standing tall peaks, श्रीमान् prosperous, सः भूमिधरश्च that mountain, रसातलम् underworld, प्रविवेश entered.
translation: Crushed by the powerful Hanuman, that prosperous mountain with its trees standing and tall peaks sank into the underworld.

meaning: दशयोजनविस्तारः ten yojanas in width, त्रिंशद्योजनम् thirty yojanas, उच्छ्रितः in height, सः धराधरः that mountain, धरण्याम् along with, समताम् equal, यातः reduced, बभूव became.
translation: That mountain of ten yojanas in width and thirty yojanas in height got levelled with the earth.

meaning: सः हरिः that vanara, भीमम् terrific, कल्लोलास्फालवेलान्तम् with huge waves dashing towards the shore, लवणार्णवम् ocean of saltwater, सलीलम् easily, लिलङ्घयिषुः desiring to cross, नभः sky, उत्पपात leaped.
translation:
Eager to leap the terrific ocean lashed by huge waves hitting the shore Hanuman rose up effortlessly and jumped into the sky.
इत्यार्षे श्रीमद्रामायणे वाल्मीकीय आदिकाव्ये सुन्दरकाण्डे षट्पञ्चाशस्सर्गः।।
Thus ends the fiftysixth sarga of Sundarakanda of the holy Ramayana, the first epic composed by sage Valmiki.
